name: County-level detection dates for beech scale in Canada and the United States

creator.name: Cale, Jonathan A
creator.affiliation: University of Alberta, Department of Renewable Resources

creator.name: Morin, Randall S
creator.affiliation: USDA Forest Service, Northern Research Station

author.name: Cale, Jonathan A
author.affiliation: University of Alberta, Department of Renewable Resources

author.name: Morin, Randall S
author.affiliation: USDA Forest Service, Northern Research Station

description: This dataset contains the years beech scale (Cryptococcus fagisuga; a predisposing agent of beech bark disease) was first detected in counties of Canada and the United states. These data were aggregated from observations made from 1890 to 2015 in order to map the spread of the insect throughout its invaded range in eastern North America. Detection year data are organized by country, province/state, and county for a total of 389 records with references to their original reporting literature.

citation.text: Cale JA, Garrison-Johnston MT, Teale SA, Castello JD. Beech bark disease in North America: Over a century of research revisited. 2017. Forest Ecology and Management.
Cale JA, Garrison-Johnston MT, Teale SA, Castello JD. Beech bark disease in North America: Over a century of research revisited. 2017. Forest Ecology and Management.

Morin RS, Liebhold AM, Tobin PC, Gottschalk KW, Luzader E. Spread of beech bark disease in the eastern United States and its relationship to regional forest composition. 2007. Canadian Journal of Forest Research.
